115 /*
116  * db_value_put_null()
117  * return : Error indicator
118  * value(out) : value container to set NULL.
119  */
120 int
121 db_value_put_null (DB_VALUE * value)
122 {
123  CHECK_1ARG_ERROR (value);
124 
125  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1;
126  value->need_clear = false;
127 
128  return NO_ERROR;
129 }
130 
131 /* For strings that have a size of 0, this check will fail, and therefore
132  * the new interface for db_make_* functions will set the value to null, which is wrong.
133  * We need to investigate if this set to 0 will work or not.
134  */
135 #define IS_INVALID_PRECISION(p,m) \
136  (((p) != DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION) && (((p) < 0) || ((p) > (m))))
137 
138 /*
139  * db_value_domain_init() - initialize value container with given type
140  * and precision/scale.
141  * return : Error indicator.
142  * value(in/out) : DB_VALUE container to initialize.
143  * type(in) : Type.
144  * precision(in) : Precision.
145  * scale(in) : Scale.
146  *
147  */
148 int
149 db_value_domain_init (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type, const int precision, const int scale)
150 {
151  int error = NO_ERROR;
152 
153  CHECK_1ARG_ERROR (value);
154 
155  /* It's important to initialize the codeset of the data portion since it is considered domain information. It
156  * doesn't matter what we set it to, since it will be reset correctly when data is stored in the DB_VALUE by one of
157  * the db_make* function. */
158  value->data.ch.info.codeset = 0;
159  value->domain.general_info.type = type;
160  value->domain.numeric_info.precision = precision;
161  value->domain.numeric_info.scale = scale;
162  value->need_clear = false;
163  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1;
164 
165  switch (type)
166  {
167  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
168  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
169  {
170  value->domain.numeric_info.precision = DB_DEFAULT_NUMERIC_PRECISION;
171  }
172  else
173  {
174  value->domain.numeric_info.precision = precision;
175  }
176  if (scale == DB_DEFAULT_SCALE)
177  {
178  value->domain.numeric_info.scale = DB_DEFAULT_NUMERIC_SCALE;
179  }
180  else
181  {
182  value->domain.numeric_info.scale = scale;
183  }
184  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_NUMERIC_PRECISION) || precision == 0)
185  {
186  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
187  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_NUMERIC_PRECISION);
188  value->domain.numeric_info.precision = DB_DEFAULT_NUMERIC_PRECISION;
189  value->domain.numeric_info.scale = DB_DEFAULT_NUMERIC_SCALE;
190  }
191  break;
192 
193  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
194  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
195  {
196  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
197  }
198  else
199  {
200  value->domain.char_info.length = precision;
201  }
202  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_BIT_PRECISION))
203  {
204  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
205  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_BIT_PRECISION);
206  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
207  }
208 
209  if (precision == 0)
210  {
211  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
212  }
213  value->data.ch.info.codeset = INTL_CODESET_RAW_BITS;
214  break;
215 
216  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
217  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
218  {
219  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARBIT_PRECISION;
220  }
221  else
222  {
223  value->domain.char_info.length = precision;
224  }
225  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_VARBIT_PRECISION))
226  {
227  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
228  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_VARBIT_PRECISION);
229  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARBIT_PRECISION;
230  }
231 
232  if (precision == 0)
233  {
234  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARBIT_PRECISION;
235  }
236  value->data.ch.info.codeset = INTL_CODESET_RAW_BITS;
237  break;
238 
239  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
240  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
241  {
242  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
243  }
244  else
245  {
246  value->domain.char_info.length = precision;
247  }
248  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_CHAR_PRECISION))
249  {
250  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
251  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_CHAR_PRECISION);
252  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
253  }
254 
255  if (precision == 0)
256  {
257  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
258  }
259  value->data.ch.info.codeset = LANG_SYS_CODESET;
260  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = LANG_SYS_COLLATION;
261  break;
262 
263  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
264  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
265  {
266  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
267  }
268  else
269  {
270  value->domain.char_info.length = precision;
271  }
272  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_NCHAR_PRECISION))
273  {
274  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
275  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_NCHAR_PRECISION);
276  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
277  }
278 
279  if (precision == 0)
280  {
281  value->domain.char_info.length = TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE;
282  }
283  value->data.ch.info.codeset = LANG_SYS_CODESET;
284  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = LANG_SYS_COLLATION;
285  break;
286 
287  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
288  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
289  {
290  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARCHAR_PRECISION;
291  }
292  else
293  {
294  value->domain.char_info.length = precision;
295  }
296  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_VARCHAR_PRECISION))
297  {
298  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
299  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_VARCHAR_PRECISION);
300  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARCHAR_PRECISION;
301  }
302 
303  if (precision == 0)
304  {
305  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARCHAR_PRECISION;
306  }
307  value->data.ch.info.codeset = LANG_SYS_CODESET;
308  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = LANG_SYS_COLLATION;
309  break;
310 
311  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
312  if (precision == DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION)
313  {
314  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARNCHAR_PRECISION;
315  }
316  else
317  {
318  value->domain.char_info.length = precision;
319  }
320  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (precision, DB_MAX_VARNCHAR_PRECISION))
321  {
322  error = ER_INVALID_PRECISION;
323  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_INVALID_PRECISION, 3, precision, 0, DB_MAX_VARNCHAR_PRECISION);
324  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARNCHAR_PRECISION;
325  }
326 
327  if (precision == 0)
328  {
329  value->domain.char_info.length = DB_MAX_VARNCHAR_PRECISION;
330  }
331  value->data.ch.info.codeset = LANG_SYS_CODESET;
332  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = LANG_SYS_COLLATION;
333  break;
334 
335  case DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION:
336  value->data.enumeration.str_val.info.codeset = LANG_SYS_CODESET;
337  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = LANG_SYS_COLLATION;
338  break;
339 
340  case DB_TYPE_JSON:
341  value->data.json.document = NULL;
342  value->data.json.schema_raw = NULL;
343  break;
344 
345  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
346  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
347  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
348  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
349  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
350  case DB_TYPE_OBJECT:
351  case DB_TYPE_SET:
352  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
353  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
354  case DB_TYPE_MIDXKEY:
355  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
356  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
357  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
358  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
359  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPTZ:
360  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPLTZ:
361  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
362  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMETZ:
363  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMELTZ:
364  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
365  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
366  case DB_TYPE_VARIABLE:
367  case DB_TYPE_SUB:
368  case DB_TYPE_POINTER:
369  case DB_TYPE_ERROR:
370  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
371  case DB_TYPE_VOBJ:
372  case DB_TYPE_OID:
373  break;
374 
375  default:
376  error = ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE;
377  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE, 0);
378  break;
379  }
380 
381  return error;
382 }
383 
384 // db_value_domain_init_default - default value initialization
385 //
386 // value - db_value to init
387 // type - desired type of value
388 //
389 void
390 db_value_domain_init_default (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type)
391 {
392  // default initialization should not fail
393  (void) db_value_domain_init (value, type, DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION, DB_DEFAULT_SCALE);
394 }
395 
396 /*
397  * db_value_domain_min() - Initialize value(db_value_init)
398  * and set to the minimum value of the domain.
399  * return : Error indicator.
400  * value(in/out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE.
401  * type(in) : type.
402  * precision(in) : precision.
403  * scale(in) : scale.
404  * codeset(in) : codeset.
405  * collation_id(in): collation_id.
406  * enumeration(in) : enumeration elements for DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION.
407  */
408 int
409 db_value_domain_min (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type,
410  const int precision, const int scale, const int codeset,
411  const int collation_id, const DB_ENUMERATION * enumeration)
412 {
413  int error;
414 
415  error = db_value_domain_init (value, type, precision, scale);
416  if (error != NO_ERROR)
417  {
418  return error;
419  }
420 
421  switch (type)
422  {
423  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
424  break;
425  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
426  value->data.i = DB_INT32_MIN;
427  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
428  break;
429  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
430  value->data.bigint = DB_BIGINT_MIN;
431  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
432  break;
433  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
434  /* FLT_MIN is minimum normalized positive floating-point number. */
435  value->data.f = -FLT_MAX;
436  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
437  break;
438  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
439  /* DBL_MIN is minimum normalized positive double precision number. */
440  value->data.d = -DBL_MAX;
441  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
442  break;
443  /* case DB_TYPE_OBJECT: not in server-side code */
444  case DB_TYPE_SET:
445  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
446  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
447  value->data.set = NULL;
448  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1; /* NULL SET value */
449  break;
450  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
451  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
452  elo_init_structure (&value->data.elo);
453  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1; /* NULL ELO value */
454  break;
455  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
456  value->data.time = DB_TIME_MIN;
457  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
458  break;
459  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
460  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPLTZ:
461  value->data.utime = DB_UTIME_MIN;
462  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
463  break;
464  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPTZ:
465  value->data.timestamptz.timestamp = DB_UTIME_MIN;
466  value->data.timestamptz.tz_id = *tz_get_utc_tz_id ();
467  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
468  break;
469  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
470  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMELTZ:
471  value->data.datetime.date = DB_DATE_MIN;
472  value->data.datetime.time = DB_TIME_MIN;
473  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
474  break;
475  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMETZ:
476  value->data.datetimetz.datetime.date = DB_DATE_MIN;
477  value->data.datetimetz.datetime.time = DB_TIME_MIN;
478  value->data.datetimetz.tz_id = *tz_get_utc_tz_id ();
479  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
480  break;
481  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
482  value->data.date = DB_DATE_MIN;
483  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
484  break;
485  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
486  /* DBL_MIN is minimum normalized positive double precision number. */
487  value->data.money.amount = -DBL_MAX;
488  value->data.money.type = DB_CURRENCY_DEFAULT;
489  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
490  break;
491  /* case DB_TYPE_VARIABLE: internal use only */
492  /* case DB_TYPE_SUB: internal use only */
493  /* case DB_TYPE_POINTER: method arguments only */
494  /* case DB_TYPE_ERROR: method arguments only */
495  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
496  value->data.sh = DB_INT16_MIN;
497  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
498  break;
499  /* case DB_TYPE_VOBJ: internal use only */
500  case DB_TYPE_OID:
501  value->data.oid.pageid = NULL_PAGEID;
502  value->data.oid.slotid = NULL_PAGEID;
503  value->data.oid.volid = NULL_PAGEID;
504  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
505  break;
506  /* case DB_TYPE_DB_VALUE: special for esql */
507  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
508  {
509  char str[DB_MAX_NUMERIC_PRECISION + 2];
510 
511  memset (str, 0, DB_MAX_NUMERIC_PRECISION + 2);
512  str[0] = '-';
513  memset (str + 1, '9', value->domain.numeric_info.precision);
514  numeric_coerce_dec_str_to_num (str, value->data.num.d.buf);
515  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
516  }
517  break;
518  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
519  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
520  value->data.ch.info.style = MEDIUM_STRING;
521  value->data.ch.info.codeset = INTL_CODESET_RAW_BITS;
522  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = false;
523  value->data.ch.info.compressed_need_clear = false;
524  value->data.ch.medium.size = 1;
525  value->data.ch.medium.buf = (char *) "\0"; /* zero; 0 */
526  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_buf = NULL;
527  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_size = 0;
528  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
529  break;
530  /* case DB_TYPE_STRING: internally DB_TYPE_VARCHAR */
531  /* space is the min value, matching the comparison in qstr_compare */
532  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
533  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
534  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
535  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
536  value->data.ch.info.style = MEDIUM_STRING;
537  value->data.ch.info.codeset = codeset;
538  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = false;
539  value->data.ch.info.compressed_need_clear = false;
540  value->data.ch.medium.size = 1;
541  value->data.ch.medium.buf = (char *) "\40"; /* space; 32 */
542  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_buf = NULL;
543  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_size = 0;
544  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
545  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = collation_id;
546  break;
547  case DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION:
548  db_make_enumeration (value, 0, NULL, 0, codeset, collation_id);
549  break;
550  /* case DB_TYPE_TABLE: internal use only */
551  case DB_TYPE_JSON:
552  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1;
553  value->need_clear = false;
554  break;
555  default:
556  error = ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE;
557  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE, 0);
558  break;
559  }
560 
561  return error;
562 }
563 
564 /*
565  * db_value_domain_max() - Initialize value(db_value_init)
566  * and set to the maximum value of the domain.
567  * return : Error indicator.
568  * value(in/out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE.
569  * type(in) : type.
570  * precision(in) : precision.
571  * scale(in) : scale.
572  * codeset(in) : codeset.
573  * collation_id(in): collation_id.
574  * enumeration(in) : enumeration elements for DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION.
575  */
576 int
577 db_value_domain_max (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type,
578  const int precision, const int scale, const int codeset,
579  const int collation_id, const DB_ENUMERATION * enumeration)
580 {
581  int error;
582 
583  error = db_value_domain_init (value, type, precision, scale);
584  if (error != NO_ERROR)
585  {
586  return error;
587  }
588 
589  switch (type)
590  {
591  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
592  break;
593  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
594  value->data.i = DB_INT32_MAX;
595  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
596  break;
597  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
598  value->data.bigint = DB_BIGINT_MAX;
599  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
600  break;
601  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
602  value->data.f = FLT_MAX;
603  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
604  break;
605  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
606  value->data.d = DBL_MAX;
607  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
608  break;
609  /* case DB_TYPE_OBJECT: not in server-side code */
610  case DB_TYPE_SET:
611  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
612  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
613  value->data.set = NULL;
614  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1; /* NULL SET value */
615  break;
616  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
617  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
618  elo_init_structure (&value->data.elo);
619  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1; /* NULL ELO value */
620  break;
621  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
622  value->data.time = DB_TIME_MAX;
623  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
624  break;
625  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
626  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPLTZ:
627  value->data.utime = DB_UTIME_MAX;
628  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
629  break;
630  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPTZ:
631  value->data.timestamptz.timestamp = DB_UTIME_MAX;
632  value->data.timestamptz.tz_id = *tz_get_utc_tz_id ();
633  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
634  break;
635  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
636  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMELTZ:
637  value->data.datetime.date = DB_DATE_MAX;
638  value->data.datetime.time = DB_TIME_MAX;
639  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
640  break;
641  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMETZ:
642  value->data.datetimetz.datetime.date = DB_DATE_MAX;
643  value->data.datetimetz.datetime.time = DB_TIME_MAX;
644  value->data.datetimetz.tz_id = *tz_get_utc_tz_id ();
645  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
646  break;
647  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
648  value->data.date = DB_DATE_MAX;
649  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
650  break;
651  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
652  value->data.money.amount = DBL_MAX;
653  value->data.money.type = DB_CURRENCY_DEFAULT;
654  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
655  break;
656  /* case DB_TYPE_VARIABLE: internal use only */
657  /* case DB_TYPE_SUB: internal use only */
658  /* case DB_TYPE_POINTER: method arguments only */
659  /* case DB_TYPE_ERROR: method arguments only */
660  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
661  value->data.sh = DB_INT16_MAX;
662  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
663  break;
664  /* case DB_TYPE_VOBJ: internal use only */
665  case DB_TYPE_OID:
666  value->data.oid.pageid = DB_INT32_MAX;
667  value->data.oid.slotid = DB_INT16_MAX;
668  value->data.oid.volid = DB_INT16_MAX;
669  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
670  break;
671  /* case DB_TYPE_DB_VALUE: special for esql */
672  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
673  {
674  char str[DB_MAX_NUMERIC_PRECISION + 1];
675 
676  memset (str, 0, DB_MAX_NUMERIC_PRECISION + 1);
677  memset (str, '9', value->domain.numeric_info.precision);
678  numeric_coerce_dec_str_to_num (str, value->data.num.d.buf);
679  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
680  }
681  break;
682  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
683  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
684  value->data.ch.info.style = MEDIUM_STRING;
685  value->data.ch.info.codeset = INTL_CODESET_RAW_BITS;
686  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = true;
687  value->data.ch.info.compressed_need_clear = false;
688  value->data.ch.medium.size = 0;
689  value->data.ch.medium.buf = NULL;
690  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_buf = NULL;
691  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_size = 0;
692  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
693  break;
694  /* case DB_TYPE_STRING: internally DB_TYPE_VARCHAR */
695  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
696  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
697  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
698  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
699  /* Case for the maximum String type. Just set the is_max_string flag to TRUE. */
700  value->data.ch.info.style = MEDIUM_STRING;
701  value->data.ch.info.codeset = codeset;
702  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = true;
703  value->data.ch.info.compressed_need_clear = false;
704  value->data.ch.medium.size = 0;
705  value->data.ch.medium.buf = NULL;
706  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_buf = NULL;
707  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_size = 0;
708  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
709  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = collation_id;
710  break;
711  case DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION:
712  if (enumeration == NULL || enumeration->count <= 0)
713  {
714  db_make_enumeration (value, DB_ENUM_ELEMENTS_MAX, NULL, 0, (unsigned char) codeset, collation_id);
715  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = true;
716  }
717  else
718  {
719  db_make_enumeration (value, enumeration->count,
720  enumeration->elements[enumeration->count - 1].str_val.medium.buf,
721  enumeration->elements[enumeration->count - 1].str_val.medium.size,
722  (unsigned char) codeset, collation_id);
723  }
724  break;
725  /* case DB_TYPE_TABLE: internal use only */
726  case DB_TYPE_JSON:
727  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1;
728  value->need_clear = false;
729  default:
730  error = ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE;
731  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE, 0);
732  break;
733  }
734 
735  return error;
736 }
737 
738 /*
739  * db_value_domain_default() - Initialize value(db_value_init)
740  * and set to the default value of the domain.
741  * return : Error indicator
742  * value(in/out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE
743  * type(in) : type
744  * precision(in) : precision
745  * scale(in) : scale
746  * codeset(in) : codeset.
747  * collation_id(in): collation_id.
748  * enumeration(in) : enumeration elements for DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION
749  */
750 int
751 db_value_domain_default (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type,
752  const int precision, const int scale,
753  const int codeset, const int collation_id, DB_ENUMERATION * enumeration)
754 {
755  int error = NO_ERROR;
756 
757  if (TP_IS_NUMERIC_TYPE (type))
758  {
759  return db_value_domain_zero (value, type, precision, scale);
760  }
761 
762  error = db_value_domain_init (value, type, precision, scale);
763  if (error != NO_ERROR)
764  {
765  return error;
766  }
767 
768  switch (type)
769  {
770  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
771  break;
772  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
773  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
774  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
775  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
776  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
777  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
778  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
779  assert (false);
780  break;
781  case DB_TYPE_SET:
782  /* empty set */
783  db_make_set (value, db_set_create_basic (NULL, NULL));
784  break;
785  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
786  /* empty multi-set */
787  db_make_multiset (value, db_set_create_multi (NULL, NULL));
788  break;
789  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
790  /* empty sequence */
791  db_make_sequence (value, db_seq_create (NULL, NULL, 0));
792  break;
793  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
794  value->data.time = DB_TIME_MIN;
795  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
796  break;
797  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
798  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPLTZ:
799  value->data.utime = DB_UTIME_MIN;
800  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
801  break;
802  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPTZ:
803  value->data.timestamptz.timestamp = DB_UTIME_MIN;
804  value->data.timestamptz.tz_id = *tz_get_utc_tz_id ();
805  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
806  break;
807  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
808  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMELTZ:
809  value->data.datetime.date = DB_DATE_MIN;
810  value->data.datetime.time = DB_TIME_MIN;
811  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
812  break;
813  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMETZ:
814  value->data.datetimetz.datetime.date = DB_DATE_MIN;
815  value->data.datetimetz.datetime.time = DB_TIME_MIN;
816  value->data.datetimetz.tz_id = *tz_get_utc_tz_id ();
817  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
818  break;
819  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
820  value->data.date = DB_DATE_MIN;
821  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
822  break;
823  case DB_TYPE_OID:
824  value->data.oid.pageid = NULL_PAGEID;
825  value->data.oid.slotid = NULL_PAGEID;
826  value->data.oid.volid = NULL_PAGEID;
827  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
828  break;
829  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
830  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
831  db_make_bit (value, 1, (const DB_C_BIT) "0", 1);
832  break;
833  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
834  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
835  value->data.ch.info.style = MEDIUM_STRING;
836  value->data.ch.info.codeset = codeset;
837  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = false;
838  value->data.ch.info.compressed_need_clear = false;
839  value->data.ch.medium.size = 0;
840  value->data.ch.medium.buf = (char *) "";
841  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_buf = NULL;
842  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_size = 0;
843  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
844  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = collation_id;
845  break;
846  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
847  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
848  value->data.ch.info.style = MEDIUM_STRING;
849  value->data.ch.info.codeset = codeset;
850  value->data.ch.info.compressed_need_clear = false;
851  value->data.ch.info.is_max_string = false;
852  value->data.ch.medium.size = 1;
853  value->data.ch.medium.buf = (char *) "";
854  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_buf = NULL;
855  value->data.ch.medium.compressed_size = 0;
856  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
857  value->domain.char_info.collation_id = collation_id;
858  break;
859  case DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION:
860  db_make_enumeration (value, 0, NULL, 0, codeset, collation_id);
861  break;
862  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
863  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
864  value->data.elo.type = ELO_NULL;
865  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
866  break;
867 #if 1 /* TODO - */
868  case DB_TYPE_OBJECT:
869  case DB_TYPE_MIDXKEY:
870  case DB_TYPE_VARIABLE:
871  case DB_TYPE_SUB:
872  case DB_TYPE_POINTER:
873  case DB_TYPE_ERROR:
874  case DB_TYPE_VOBJ:
875 #endif
876  default:
877  error = ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE;
878  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE, 0);
879  break;
880  }
881 
882  return error;
883 }
884 
885 /*
886  * db_value_domain_zero() - Initialize value(db_value_init)
887  * and set to the value 'zero' of the domain.
888  * return : Error indicator
889  * value(in/out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE
890  * type(in) : type
891  * precision(in) : precision
892  * scale(in) : scale
893  *
894  * Note : this makes sense only for number data types, for all other
895  * types it returns an error (ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE);
896  */
897 int
898 db_value_domain_zero (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type, const int precision, const int scale)
899 {
900  int error = NO_ERROR;
901 
902  assert (TP_IS_NUMERIC_TYPE (type));
903 
904  error = db_value_domain_init (value, type, precision, scale);
905  if (error != NO_ERROR)
906  {
907  return error;
908  }
909 
910  switch (type)
911  {
912  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
913  value->data.i = DB_NUMBER_ZERO;
914  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
915  break;
916  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
917  value->data.bigint = DB_NUMBER_ZERO;
918  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
919  break;
920  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
921  value->data.f = DB_NUMBER_ZERO;
922  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
923  break;
924  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
925  value->data.d = DB_NUMBER_ZERO;
926  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
927  break;
928  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
929  value->data.money.amount = DB_NUMBER_ZERO;
930  value->data.money.type = DB_CURRENCY_DEFAULT;
931  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
932  break;
933  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
934  value->data.sh = DB_NUMBER_ZERO;
935  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
936  break;
937  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
938  numeric_coerce_dec_str_to_num ("0", value->data.num.d.buf);
939  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
940  break;
941  default:
942  error = ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE;
943  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE, 0);
944  break;
945  }
946 
947  return error;
948 }
949 
950 /*
951  * db_string_truncate() - truncate string in DB_TYPE_STRING value container
952  * return : Error indicator.
953  * value(in/out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE
954  * precision(in) : value's precision after truncate.
955  */
956 int
957 db_string_truncate (DB_VALUE * value, const int precision)
958 {
959  int error = NO_ERROR;
960  DB_VALUE src_value;
961  char *string = NULL, *val_str;
962  int length;
963  int byte_size;
964 
965  switch (DB_VALUE_TYPE (value))
966  {
967  case DB_TYPE_STRING:
968  val_str = db_get_string (value);
969  if (val_str != NULL && db_get_string_length (value) > precision)
970  {
971  intl_char_size ((unsigned char *) val_str, precision, db_get_string_codeset (value), &byte_size);
972  string = (char *) db_private_alloc (NULL, byte_size + 1);
973  if (string == NULL)
974  {
975  error = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
976  break;
977  }
978 
979  assert (byte_size < db_get_string_size (value));
980  strncpy (string, val_str, byte_size);
981  string[byte_size] = '\0';
982  db_make_varchar (&src_value, precision, string, byte_size,
983  db_get_string_codeset (value), db_get_string_collation (value));
984 
985  pr_clear_value (value);
986  (*(tp_String.setval)) (value, &src_value, true);
987 
988  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
989  }
990  break;
991 
992  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
993  val_str = db_get_char (value, &length);
994  if (val_str != NULL && length > precision)
995  {
996  intl_char_size ((unsigned char *) val_str, precision, db_get_string_codeset (value), &byte_size);
997  string = (char *) db_private_alloc (NULL, byte_size + 1);
998  if (string == NULL)
999  {
1000  error = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1001  break;
1002  }
1003 
1004  assert (byte_size < db_get_string_size (value));
1005  strncpy (string, val_str, byte_size);
1006  string[byte_size] = '\0';
1007  db_make_char (&src_value, precision, string, byte_size,
1008  db_get_string_codeset (value), db_get_string_collation (value));
1009 
1010  pr_clear_value (value);
1011  (*(tp_Char.setval)) (value, &src_value, true);
1012 
1013  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
1014 
1015  }
1016  break;
1017 
1018  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
1019  val_str = db_get_nchar (value, &length);
1020  if (val_str != NULL && length > precision)
1021  {
1022  intl_char_size ((unsigned char *) val_str, precision, db_get_string_codeset (value), &byte_size);
1023  string = (char *) db_private_alloc (NULL, byte_size + 1);
1024  if (string == NULL)
1025  {
1026  error = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1027  break;
1028  }
1029 
1030  assert (byte_size < db_get_string_size (value));
1031  strncpy (string, val_str, byte_size);
1032  string[byte_size] = '\0';
1033  db_make_varnchar (&src_value, precision, string, byte_size,
1034  db_get_string_codeset (value), db_get_string_collation (value));
1035 
1036  pr_clear_value (value);
1037  (*(tp_VarNChar.setval)) (value, &src_value, true);
1038 
1039  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
1040  }
1041  break;
1042 
1043  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
1044  val_str = db_get_nchar (value, &length);
1045  if (val_str != NULL && length > precision)
1046  {
1047  intl_char_size ((unsigned char *) val_str, precision, db_get_string_codeset (value), &byte_size);
1048  string = (char *) db_private_alloc (NULL, byte_size + 1);
1049  if (string == NULL)
1050  {
1051  error = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1052  break;
1053  }
1054 
1055  assert (byte_size < db_get_string_size (value));
1056  strncpy (string, val_str, byte_size);
1057  string[byte_size] = '\0';
1058  db_make_nchar (&src_value, precision, string, byte_size,
1059  db_get_string_codeset (value), db_get_string_collation (value));
1060 
1061  pr_clear_value (value);
1062  (*(tp_NChar.setval)) (value, &src_value, true);
1063 
1064  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
1065 
1066  }
1067  break;
1068 
1069  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
1070  val_str = db_get_bit (value, &length);
1071  length = (length + 7) >> 3;
1072  if (val_str != NULL && length > precision)
1073  {
1074  string = (char *) db_private_alloc (NULL, precision);
1075  if (string == NULL)
1076  {
1077  error = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1078  break;
1079  }
1080 
1081  memcpy (string, val_str, precision);
1082  db_make_bit (&src_value, precision << 3, string, precision << 3);
1083 
1084  pr_clear_value (value);
1085  (*(tp_Bit.setval)) (value, &src_value, true);
1086 
1087  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
1088  }
1089  break;
1090 
1091  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
1092  val_str = db_get_bit (value, &length);
1093  length = (length >> 3) + ((length & 7) ? 1 : 0);
1094  if (val_str != NULL && length > precision)
1095  {
1096  string = (char *) db_private_alloc (NULL, precision);
1097  if (string == NULL)
1098  {
1099  error = ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY;
1100  break;
1101  }
1102 
1103  memcpy (string, val_str, precision);
1104  db_make_varbit (&src_value, precision << 3, string, precision << 3);
1105 
1106  pr_clear_value (value);
1107  (*(tp_VarBit.setval)) (value, &src_value, true);
1108 
1109  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
1110 
1111  }
1112  break;
1113 
1114  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
1115  break;
1116  default:
1117  {
1118  error = ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE;
1119  er_set (ER_WARNING_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_INVALID_DATA_TYPE, 0);
1120  }
1121  break;
1122  }
1123 
1124  if (string != NULL)
1125  {
1126  db_private_free (NULL, string);
1127  }
1128 
1129  return error;
1130 }
1131 
1132 /*
1133  * db_value_type_is_collection() -
1134  * return :
1135  * value(in) :
1136  */
1137 bool
1138 db_value_type_is_collection (const DB_VALUE * value)
1139 {
1140  bool is_collection;
1141  DB_TYPE type;
1142 
1143  CHECK_1ARG_FALSE (value);
1144 
1145  type = db_value_type (value);
1146  is_collection = (TP_IS_SET_TYPE (type) || type == DB_TYPE_VOBJ);
1147 
1148  return is_collection;
1149 }

1151 #if defined (ENABLE_UNUSED_FUNCTION)
1152 /*
1153  * db_value_eh_key() -
1154  * return :
1155  * value(in) :
1156  */
1157 void *
1158 db_value_eh_key (DB_VALUE * value)
1159 {
1160  DB_OBJECT *obj;
1161 
1162  CHECK_1ARG_NULL (value);
1163 
1164  switch (value->domain.general_info.type)
1165  {
1166  case DB_TYPE_STRING:
1167  return db_get_string (value);
1168  case DB_TYPE_OBJECT:
1169  obj = db_get_object (value);
1170  if (obj == NULL)
1171  {
1172  return NULL;
1173  }
1174  else
1175  {
1176  return WS_OID (obj);
1177  }
1178  default:
1179  return &value->data;
1180  }
1181 }

1204 DB_DATA *

1212 /*
1213  * db_value_alter_type() - change the type of given value container.
1214  * return : Error indicator.
1215  * value(in/out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE.
1216  * type(in) : new type.
1217  */
1218 int
1219 db_value_alter_type (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE type)
1220 {
1221  CHECK_1ARG_ERROR (value);
1222 
1223  value->domain.general_info.type = type;
1224  return NO_ERROR;
1225 }
1226 
1227 /*
1228  * db_value_put() -
1229  *
1230  * return: an error indicator
1231  * ER_DB_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION -
1232  * The C type to DB type conversion is not supported.
1233  *
1234  * ER_OBJ_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR -
1235  * An error occurred while performing the requested conversion.
1236  *
1237  * ER_OBJ_INVALID_ARGUMENTS - The value pointer is NULL.
1238  *
1239  * value(out) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE. The value container will need
1240  * to be initialized prior to entry as explained below.
1241  * c_type(in) : The type of the C destination buffer (and, therefore, an
1242  * indication of the type of coercion desired)
1243  * input(in) : Pointer to a C buffer
1244  * input_length(in): The length of the buffer. The buffer length is measured
1245  * in bit for C types DB_C_BIT and DB_C_VARBIT and is
1246  * measured in bytes for all other types.
1247  *
1248  */
1249 int
1250 db_value_put (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE_C c_type, void *input, const int input_length)
1251 {
1252  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
1253  int status = C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR;
1254 
1255  if ((value == NULL) || (input == NULL))
1256  {
1257  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OBJ_INVALID_ARGUMENTS, 0);
1258  return ER_OBJ_INVALID_ARGUMENTS;
1259  }
1260  else if (input_length == -1)
1261  {
1262  db_make_null (value);
1263  return NO_ERROR;
1264  }
1265 
1266  switch (c_type)
1267  {
1268  case DB_TYPE_C_CHAR:
1269  case DB_TYPE_C_VARCHAR:
1270  case DB_TYPE_C_NCHAR:
1271  case DB_TYPE_C_VARNCHAR:
1272  status = coerce_char_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input, input_length);
1273  break;
1274  case DB_TYPE_C_INT:
1275  case DB_TYPE_C_SHORT:
1276  case DB_TYPE_C_LONG:
1277  case DB_TYPE_C_FLOAT:
1278  case DB_TYPE_C_DOUBLE:
1279  case DB_TYPE_C_MONETARY:
1280  status = coerce_numeric_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input, c_type);
1281  break;
1282  case DB_TYPE_C_BIT:
1283  case DB_TYPE_C_VARBIT:
1284  status = coerce_binary_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input, input_length);
1285  break;
1286  case DB_TYPE_C_DATE:
1287  status = coerce_date_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input);
1288  break;
1289  case DB_TYPE_C_TIME:
1290  status = coerce_time_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input);
1291  break;
1292  case DB_TYPE_C_TIMESTAMP:
1293  status = coerce_timestamp_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input);
1294  break;
1295  case DB_TYPE_C_DATETIME:
1296  status = coerce_datetime_to_dbvalue (value, (char *) input);
1297  break;
1298  case DB_TYPE_C_OBJECT:
1299  if (DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value) == DB_TYPE_OBJECT)
1300  {
1301  db_make_object (value, *(DB_C_OBJECT **) input);
1302  }
1303  else
1304  {
1305  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
1306  }
1307  break;
1308  case DB_TYPE_C_SET:
1309  switch (DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value))
1310  {
1311  case DB_TYPE_SET:
1312  db_make_set (value, *(DB_C_SET **) input);
1313  break;
1314  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
1315  db_make_multiset (value, *(DB_C_SET **) input);
1316  break;
1317  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
1318  db_make_sequence (value, *(DB_C_SET **) input);
1319  break;
1320  default:
1321  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
1322  break;
1323  }
1324  break;
1325  default:
1326  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
1327  break;
1328  }
1329 
1330  if (status == C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION)
1331  {
1332  error_code = ER_DB_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
1333  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_DB_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION, 1, "db_value_put");
1334  }
1335  else if (status == C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR)
1336  {
1337  error_code = ER_OBJ_INVALID_ARGUMENTS;
1338  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OBJ_INVALID_ARGUMENTS, 0);
1339  }
1340 
1341  return error_code;
1342 }
1343 
1344 /*
1345  * db_value_put_encoded_time() -
1346  * return :
1347  * value(out):
1348  * time(in):
1349  */
1350 int
1351 db_value_put_encoded_time (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TIME * time)
1352 {
1353  CHECK_1ARG_ERROR (value);
1354 
1355  value->domain.general_info.type = DB_TYPE_TIME;
1356  value->need_clear = false;
1357  if (time)
1358  {
1359  value->data.time = *time;
1360  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 0;
1361  }
1362  else
1363  {
1364  value->domain.general_info.is_null = 1;
1365  }
1366 
1367  return NO_ERROR;
1368 }

1371  * db_value_put_encoded_date() -

1522 /*
1523  * db_value_copy()- A new value is created and a copy is made of the contents
1524  * of the supplied container. If the supplied value contains
1525  * external allocates such as strings or sets,
1526  * the external strings or sets are copied as well.
1527  * return : A newly created value container.
1528  * value(in) : The value to copy.
1529  */
1530 DB_VALUE *
1531 db_value_copy (DB_VALUE * value)
1532 {
1533  DB_VALUE *new_ = NULL;
1534 
1535  CHECK_CONNECT_NULL ();
1536 
1537  if (value != NULL)
1538  {
1539  new_ = pr_make_ext_value ();
1540  pr_clone_value (value, new_);
1541  }
1542 
1543  return (new_);
1544 }
1545 
1546 /*
1547  * db_value_clone() - Copies the contents of one value to another without
1548  * allocating a new container.
1549  * The destination container is NOT initialized prior
1550  * to the clone so it must be cleared before calling this
1551  * function.
1552  * return : Error indicator
1553  * src(in) : DB_VALUE pointer of source value container.
1554  * dest(out) : DB_VALUE pointer of destination value container.
1555  *
1556  */
1557 int
1558 db_value_clone (DB_VALUE * src, DB_VALUE * dest)
1559 {
1560  int error = NO_ERROR;
1561 
1562  CHECK_CONNECT_ERROR ();
1563 
1564  if (src != NULL && dest != NULL)
1565  {
1566  error = pr_clone_value (src, dest);
1567  }
1568 
1569  return error;
1570 }
1571 
1572 /*
1573  * db_value_clear() - the value container is initialized to an empty state
1574  * the internal type tag will be set to DB_TYPE_NULL. Any external
1575  * allocations such as strings or sets will be freed.
1576  * The container itself is not freed and may be reused.
1577  * return: Error indicator
1578  * value(out) : the value to clear
1579  *
1580  */
1581 int
1582 db_value_clear (DB_VALUE * value)
1583 {
1584  int error = NO_ERROR;
1585 
1586  /* don't check connection here, we always allow things to be freed */
1587  if (value != NULL)
1588  {
1589  error = pr_clear_value (value);
1590  }
1591 
1592  return error;
1593 }
1594 
1595 /*
1596  * db_value_free() - the value container is cleared and freed. Any external
1597  * allocations within the container such as strings or sets will also
1598  * be freed.
1599  *
1600  * return : Error indicator.
1601  * value(out) : The value to free.
1602  */
1603 int
1604 db_value_free (DB_VALUE * value)
1605 {
1606  int error = NO_ERROR;
1607 
1608  /* don't check connection here, we always allow things to be freed */
1609  if (value != NULL)
1610  {
1611  error = pr_free_ext_value (value);
1612  }
1613 
1614  return error;
1615 }
1616 
1617 /*
1618  * db_value_clear_array() - all the value containers in the values array are
1619  * initialized to an empty state; their internal type tag will be set
1620  * to DB_TYPE_NULL. Any external allocations such as strings or sets
1621  * will be freed.
1622  * The array itself is not freed and may be reused.
1623  * return: Error indicator
1624  * value_array(out) : the value array to clear
1625  */
1626 int
1627 db_value_clear_array (DB_VALUE_ARRAY * value_array)
1628 {
1629  int error = NO_ERROR;
1630  int i = 0;
1631 
1632  assert (value_array != NULL && value_array->size >= 0);
1633 
1634  for (i = 0; i < value_array->size; ++i)
1635  {
1636  int tmp_error = NO_ERROR;
1637 
1638  assert (value_array->vals != NULL);
1639 
1640  /* don't check connection here, we always allow things to be freed */
1641  tmp_error = pr_clear_value (&value_array->vals[i]);
1642  if (tmp_error != NO_ERROR && error == NO_ERROR)
1643  {
1644  error = tmp_error;
1645  }
1646  }
1647 
1648  return error;
1649 }

1686 /*
1687  * db_type_to_db_domain() - see the note below.
1688  *
1689  * return : DB_DOMAIN of a primitive DB_TYPE, returns NULL otherwise
1690  * type(in) : a primitive DB_TYPE
1691  *
1692  * note:
1693  * This function is used only in special cases where we need to get the
1694  * DB_DOMAIN of a primitive DB_TYPE that has no domain parameters, or of a
1695  * parameterized DB_TYPE with the default domain parameters.
1696  *
1697  * For example, it can be used to get the DB_DOMAIN of primitive
1698  * DB_TYPES like DB_TYPE_INTEGER, DB_TYPE_FLOAT, etc., or of
1699  * DB_TYPE_NUMERIC(DB_DEFAULT_NUMERIC_PRECISION, DB_DEFAULT_NUMERIC_SCALE).
1700  *
1701  * This function CANNOT be used to get the DB_DOMAIN of
1702  * set/multiset/sequence and object DB_TYPEs.
1703  */
1704 DB_DOMAIN *
1705 db_type_to_db_domain (const DB_TYPE type)
1706 {
1707  DB_DOMAIN *result = NULL;
1708 
1709  switch (type)
1710  {
1711  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
1712  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
1713  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
1714  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
1715  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
1716  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPTZ:
1717  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMPLTZ:
1718  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
1719  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMETZ:
1720  case DB_TYPE_DATETIMELTZ:
1721  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
1722  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
1723  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
1724  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
1725  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
1726  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
1727  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
1728  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
1729  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
1730  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
1731  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
1732  case DB_TYPE_SET:
1733  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
1734  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
1735  case DB_TYPE_NULL:
1736  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
1737  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
1738  case DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION:
1739  case DB_TYPE_ELO:
1740  case DB_TYPE_JSON:
1741  result = tp_domain_resolve_default (type);
1742  break;
1743  case DB_TYPE_SUB:
1744  case DB_TYPE_POINTER:
1745  case DB_TYPE_ERROR:
1746  case DB_TYPE_VOBJ:
1747  case DB_TYPE_OID:
1748  case DB_TYPE_OBJECT:
1749  case DB_TYPE_DB_VALUE:
1750  case DB_TYPE_VARIABLE:
1751  case DB_TYPE_RESULTSET:
1752  case DB_TYPE_MIDXKEY:
1753  case DB_TYPE_TABLE:
1754  result = NULL;
1755  break;
1756 
1757  /* NO DEFAULT CASE!!!!! ALL TYPES MUST GET HANDLED HERE! */
1758  default:
1759  assert (0);
1760  break;
1761  }
1762 
1763  return result;
1764 }
1765 
1766 /*
1767  * db_value_coerce()-coerces a DB_VALUE to another compatible DB_VALUE domain.
1768  * return : error indicator.
1769  * src(in) : a pointer to the original DB_VALUE.
1770  * dest(in/out) : a pointer to a place to put the coerced DB_VALUE.
1771  * desired_domain(in) : the desired domain of the coerced result.
1772  */
1773 int
1774 db_value_coerce (const DB_VALUE * src, DB_VALUE * dest, const DB_DOMAIN * desired_domain)
1775 {
1776  TP_DOMAIN_STATUS status;
1777  int err = NO_ERROR;
1778 
1779  status = tp_value_cast (src, dest, desired_domain, false);
1780  if (status != DOMAIN_COMPATIBLE)
1781  {
1782  err = tp_domain_status_er_set (status, ARG_FILE_LINE, src, desired_domain);
1783  }
1784 
1785  return err;
1786 }

1788 /*
1789  * db_value_equal()- compare two values to see if they are equal.
1790  * return : non-zero if equal, zero if not equal
1791  * value1(in) : value container to compare.
1792  * value2(in) : value container to compare.
1793  *
1794  * note : this is a boolean test, the sign or magnitude of the non-zero return
1795  * value has no meaning.
1796  */
1797 int
1798 db_value_equal (const DB_VALUE * value1, const DB_VALUE * value2)
1799 {
1800  int retval;
1801 
1802  CHECK_CONNECT_ZERO ();
1803 
1804  /* this handles NULL arguments */
1805  retval = (tp_value_equal (value1, value2, 1));
1806 
1807  return (retval);
1808 }
1809 
1810 /*
1811  * db_set_compare() - This compares the two collection values.
1812  * It will determine if the value1 is a subset or superset of value2.
1813  * If either value is not a collection type, it will return DB_NE
1814  * If both values are set types, a set comparison will be done.
1815  * Otherwise a multiset comparison will be done.
1816  * return : DB_EQ - values are equal
1817  * DB_SUBSET - value1 is subset of value2
1818  * DB_SUPERSET - value1 is superset of value2
1819  * DB_NE - values are not both collections.
1820  * DB_UNK - collections contain NULLs preventing
1821  * a more certain answer.
1822  *
1823  * value1(in): A db_value of some collection type.
1824  * value2(in): A db_value of some collection type.
1825  *
1826  */
1827 int
1828 db_set_compare (const DB_VALUE * value1, const DB_VALUE * value2)
1829 {
1830  int retval;
1831 
1832  /* this handles NULL arguments */
1833  retval = (tp_set_compare (value1, value2, 1, 0));
1834 
1835  return (retval);
1836 }
1837 
1838 /*
1839  * db_value_compare() - Compares the two values for ordinal position
1840  * It will attempt to coerce the two values to the most general
1841  * of the two types passed in. Then a connonical comparison is done.
1842  *
1843  * return : DB_EQ - values are equal
1844  * DB_GT - value1 is cannonicaly before value2
1845  * DB_LT - value1 is cannonicaly after value2
1846  * DB_UNK - value is or contains NULLs preventing
1847  * a more certain answer
1848  */
1849 int
1850 db_value_compare (const DB_VALUE * value1, const DB_VALUE * value2)
1851 {
1852  /* this handles NULL arguments */
1853  return tp_value_compare (value1, value2, 1, 0);
1854 }

1856 /*
1857  * db_get_currency_default() - This returns the value of the default currency
1858  * identifier based on the current locale. This was formerly defined with
1859  * the variable DB_CURRENCY_DEFAULT but for the PC, we need to
1860  * have this available through a function so it can be exported through
1861  * the DLL.
1862  * return : currency identifier.
1863  */
1864 DB_CURRENCY
1865 db_get_currency_default ()

1868 }
1869 
1870 /*
1871  * transfer_string() -
1872  * return : an error indicator.
1873  *
1874  * dst(out) : pointer to destination buffer area
1875  * xflen(out) : pointer to int field that will receive the number of bytes
1876  * transferred.
1877  * outlen(out): pointer to int field that will receive an indication of number
1878  * of bytes transferred.(see the note below)
1879  * dstlen(in) : size of destination buffer area (in bytes, *including* null
1880  * terminator in the case of strings)
1881  * src(in) : pointer to source buffer area
1882  * srclen(in) : size of source buffer area (in bytes, *NOT* including null
1883  * terminator in the case of strings)
1884  * c_type(in) : the type of the destination buffer (i.e., whether it is varying
1885  * or fixed)
1886  * codeset(in): International codeset for the character string. This is needed
1887  * to properly pad the strings.
1888  *
1889  */
1890 static int
1891 transfer_string (char *dst, int *xflen, int *outlen, const int dstlen,
1892  const char *src, const int srclen, const DB_TYPE_C type, const INTL_CODESET codeset)
1893 {
1894  int code;
1895  unsigned char *ptr;
1896  int length, size;
1897 
1898  code = NO_ERROR;
1899 
1900  if (dstlen > srclen)
1901  {
1902  /*
1903  * No truncation; copy the data and blank pad if necessary.
1904  */
1905  memcpy (dst, src, srclen);
1906  if ((type == DB_TYPE_C_CHAR) || (type == DB_TYPE_C_NCHAR))
1907  {
1908  ptr =
1909  qstr_pad_string ((unsigned char *) &dst[srclen],
1910  (int) ((dstlen - srclen - 1) / intl_pad_size (codeset)), codeset);
1911  *xflen = CAST_STRLEN ((char *) ptr - (char *) dst);
1912  }
1913  else
1914  {
1915  *xflen = srclen;
1916  }
1917  dst[*xflen] = '\0';
1918 
1919  if (outlen)
1920  {
1921  *outlen = 0;
1922  }
1923  }
1924  else
1925  {
1926  /*
1927  * Truncation is necessary; put as many bytes as possible into
1928  * the receiving buffer and null-terminate it (i.e., it receives
1929  * at most dstlen-1 bytes). If there is not outlen indicator by
1930  * which we can indicate truncation, this is an error.
1931  *
1932  */
1933  intl_char_count ((unsigned char *) src, dstlen - 1, codeset, &length);
1934  intl_char_size ((unsigned char *) src, length, codeset, &size);
1935  memcpy (dst, src, size);
1936  dst[size] = '\0';
1937  *xflen = size;
1938  if (outlen)
1939  {
1940  *outlen = srclen;
1941  }
1942  else
1943  {
1944  code = ER_UCI_NULL_IND_NEEDED;
1945  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_UCI_NULL_IND_NEEDED, 0);
1946  }
1947  }
1948 
1949  return code;
1950 }
1951 
1952 /*
1953  * transfer_bit_string() -
1954  * Transfers at most buflen bytes to the region pointed at by buf.
1955  * If c_type is DB_TYPE_C_BIT, strings shorter than dstlen will be
1956  * blank-padded out to buflen-1 bytes. All strings will be
1957  * null-terminated. If truncation is necessary (i.e., if buflen is
1958  * less than or equal to length of src), *outlen is set to length of
1959  * src; if truncation is is not necessary, *outlen is set to 0.
1960  *
1961  * return : an error indicator
1962  *
1963  * buf(out) : pointer to destination buffer area
1964  * xflen(out) : Number of bits transfered from the src string to the buf.
1965  * outlen(out): pointer to a int field. *outlen will equal 0 if no
1966  * truncation occurred and will equal the size of the destination
1967  * buffer in bytes needed to avoid truncation, otherwise.
1968  * buflen(in) : size of destination buffer area in bytes
1969  * src(in) : pointer to source buffer area.
1970  * c_type(in) : the type of the destination buffer (i.e., whether it is varying
1971  * or fixed).
1972  */
1973 static int
1974 transfer_bit_string (char *buf, int *xflen, int *outlen, const int buflen, const DB_VALUE * src, const DB_TYPE_C c_type)
1975 {
1976  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
1977  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
1978  DB_TYPE db_type;
1979  int error_code;
1980  char *tmp_val_str;
1981 
1982  if (c_type == DB_TYPE_C_BIT)
1983  {
1984  db_type = DB_TYPE_BIT;
1985  }
1986  else
1987  {
1988  db_type = DB_TYPE_VARBIT;
1989  }
1990 
1991  db_value_domain_init (&tmp_value, db_type, buflen, DB_DEFAULT_SCALE);
1992  error_code = db_bit_string_coerce (src, &tmp_value, &data_status);
1993  if (error_code == NO_ERROR)
1994  {
1995  *xflen = db_get_string_length (&tmp_value);
1996  if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
1997  {
1998  if (outlen != NULL)
1999  {
2000  *outlen = db_get_string_length (src);
2001  }
2002  }
2003 
2004  tmp_val_str = db_get_string (&tmp_value);
2005  if (tmp_val_str != NULL)
2006  {
2007  memcpy (buf, tmp_val_str, db_get_string_size (&tmp_value));
2008  }
2009 
2010  error_code = db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
2011  }
2012 
2013  return error_code;
2014 }
2015 
2016 int
2017 db_get_deep_copy_of_json (const DB_JSON * src, DB_JSON * dst)
2018 {
2019  char *raw_schema_body = NULL;
2020  JSON_DOC *doc_copy = NULL;
2021 
2022  CHECK_2ARGS_ERROR (src, dst);
2023 
2024  assert (dst->document == NULL && dst->schema_raw == NULL);
2025 
2026  raw_schema_body = db_private_strdup (NULL, src->schema_raw);
2027 
2028  doc_copy = db_json_get_copy_of_doc (src->document);
2029 
2030  dst->schema_raw = raw_schema_body;
2031  dst->document = doc_copy;
2032 
2033  return NO_ERROR;
2034 }

2047 /*
2048  * db_value_get() -
2049  *
2050  * return : Error indicator.
2051  * value(in) : Pointer to a DB_VALUE
2052  * c_type(in) : The type of the C destination buffer (and, therefore, an
2053  * indication of the type of coercion desired)
2054  * buf(out) : Pointer to a C buffer
2055  * buflen(in) : The length of that buffer in bytes. The buffer should include
2056  * room for a terminating NULL character which is appended to
2057  * character strings.
2058  * xflen(out) : Pointer to a int field that will contain the number of
2059  * elemental-units transfered into the buffer. This value does
2060  * not include terminating NULL characters which are appended
2061  * to character strings. An elemental-unit will be a byte
2062  * for all types except bit strings in are represented in bits.
2063  * outlen(out) : Pointer to a int field that will contain the length
2064  * of the source if truncation occurred and 0 otherwise. This
2065  * value will be in terms of bytes for all types. <outlen>
2066  * can be used to reallocate buffer space if the buffer
2067  * was too small to contain the value.
2068  *
2069  *
2070  */
2071 int
2072 db_value_get (DB_VALUE * value, const DB_TYPE_C c_type, void *buf, const int buflen, int *xflen, int *outlen)
2073 {
2074  int error_code = NO_ERROR;
2075 
2076  if (DB_IS_NULL (value))
2077  {
2078  if (outlen)
2079  {
2080  *outlen = -1;
2081  return NO_ERROR;
2082  }
2083  else
2084  {
2085  error_code = ER_UCI_NULL_IND_NEEDED;
2086  goto error0;
2087  }
2088  }
2089 
2090  if ((buf == NULL) || (xflen == NULL))
2091  {
2092  goto invalid_args;
2093  }
2094 
2095  /*
2096  * *outlen will be non-zero only when converting to a character
2097  * output and truncation is necessary. All other cases should set
2098  * *outlen to 0 unless a NULL is encountered (which case we've
2099  * already dealt with).
2100  */
2101  if (outlen)
2102  {
2103  *outlen = 0;
2104  }
2105 
2106  /*
2107  * The numeric conversions below probably ought to be checking for
2108  * overflow and complaining when it happens. For example, trying to
2109  * get a double out into a DB_C_SHORT is likely to overflow; the
2110  * user probably wants to know about it.
2111  */
2112  switch (DB_VALUE_TYPE (value))
2113  {
2114  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
2115  {
2116  int i = db_get_int (value);
2117 
2118  switch (c_type)
2119  {
2120  case DB_TYPE_C_INT:
2121  *(DB_C_INT *) buf = (DB_C_INT) i;
2122  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_INT);
2123  break;
2124  case DB_TYPE_C_SHORT:
2125  *(DB_C_SHORT *) buf = (DB_C_SHORT) i;
2126  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_SHORT);
2127  break;
2128  case DB_TYPE_C_LONG:
2129  *(DB_C_LONG *) buf = (DB_C_LONG) i;
2130  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_LONG);
2131  break;
2132  case DB_TYPE_C_FLOAT:
2133  *(DB_C_FLOAT *) buf = (DB_C_FLOAT) i;
2134  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_FLOAT);
2135  break;
2136  case DB_TYPE_C_DOUBLE:
2137  *(DB_C_DOUBLE *) buf = (DB_C_DOUBLE) i;
2138  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_DOUBLE);
2139  break;
2140  case DB_TYPE_C_CHAR:
2141  case DB_TYPE_C_VARCHAR:
2142  {
2143  char tmp[NUM_BUF_SIZE];
2144  sprintf (tmp, "%d", i);
2145  error_code =
2146  transfer_string ((char *) buf, xflen, outlen, buflen, tmp, strlen (tmp), c_type, LANG_SYS_CODESET);
2147  }
2148  break;
2149  case DB_TYPE_C_NCHAR:
2150  case DB_TYPE_C_VARNCHAR:
2151  {
2152  char tmp[NUM_BUF_SIZE];
2153  sprintf (tmp, "%d", i);
2154  error_code =
2155  transfer_string ((char *) buf, xflen, outlen, buflen, tmp, strlen (tmp), c_type, LANG_SYS_CODESET);
2156  }
2157  break;
2158  default:
2159  goto unsupported_conversion;
2160  }
2161  } /* DB_TYPE_INT */
2162  break;
2163 
2164  case DB_TYPE_SMALLINT:
2165  {
2166  short s = db_get_short (value);
2167 
2168  switch (c_type)
2169  {
2170  case DB_TYPE_C_INT:
2171  {
2172  *(DB_C_INT *) buf = (DB_C_INT) s;
2173  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_INT);
2174  }
2175  break;
2176  case DB_TYPE_C_SHORT:
2177  {
2178  *(DB_C_SHORT *) buf = (DB_C_SHORT) s;
2179  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_SHORT);
2180  }
2181  break;
2182  case DB_TYPE_C_LONG:
2183  {
2184  *(DB_C_LONG *) buf = (DB_C_LONG) s;
2185  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_LONG);
2186  }
2187  break;
2188  case DB_TYPE_C_FLOAT:
2189  {
2190  *(DB_C_FLOAT *) buf = (DB_C_FLOAT) s;
2191  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_FLOAT);
2192  }
2193  break;
2194  case DB_TYPE_C_DOUBLE:
2195  {
2196  *(DB_C_DOUBLE *) buf = (DB_C_DOUBLE) s;
2197  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_DOUBLE);
2198  }
2199  break;
2200  case DB_TYPE_C_CHAR:
2201  case DB_TYPE_C_VARCHAR:
2202  {
2203  char tmp[NUM_BUF_SIZE];
2204  sprintf (tmp, "%d", s);
2205  error_code =
2206  transfer_string ((char *) buf, xflen, outlen, buflen, tmp, strlen (tmp), c_type, LANG_SYS_CODESET);
2207  }
2208  break;
2209  case DB_TYPE_C_NCHAR:
2210  case DB_TYPE_C_VARNCHAR:
2211  {
2212  char tmp[NUM_BUF_SIZE];
2213  sprintf (tmp, "%d", s);
2214  error_code =
2215  transfer_string ((char *) buf, xflen, outlen, buflen, tmp, strlen (tmp), c_type, LANG_SYS_CODESET);
2216  }
2217  break;
2218  default:
2219  goto unsupported_conversion;
2220  }
2221  } /* DB_TYPE_SMALLINT */
2222  break;
2223 
2224  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
2225  {
2226  DB_BIGINT bigint = db_get_bigint (value);
2227 
2228  switch (c_type)
2229  {
2230  case DB_TYPE_C_INT:
2231  *(DB_C_INT *) buf = (DB_C_INT) bigint;
2232  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_INT);
2233  break;
2234  case DB_TYPE_C_SHORT:
2235  *(DB_C_SHORT *) buf = (DB_C_SHORT) bigint;
2236  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_SHORT);
2237  break;
2238  case DB_TYPE_C_BIGINT:
2239  *(DB_C_BIGINT *) buf = (DB_C_BIGINT) bigint;
2240  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_BIGINT);
2241  break;
2242  case DB_TYPE_C_LONG:
2243  *(DB_C_LONG *) buf = (DB_C_LONG) bigint;
2244  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_LONG);
2245  break;
2246  case DB_TYPE_C_FLOAT:
2247  *(DB_C_FLOAT *) buf = (DB_C_FLOAT) bigint;
2248  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_FLOAT);
2249  break;
2250  case DB_TYPE_C_DOUBLE:
2251  *(DB_C_DOUBLE *) buf = (DB_C_DOUBLE) bigint;
2252  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_DOUBLE);
2253  break;
2254  case DB_TYPE_C_CHAR:
2255  case DB_TYPE_C_VARCHAR:
2256  {
2257  char tmp[NUM_BUF_SIZE];
2258  sprintf (tmp, "%lld", (long long) bigint);
2259  error_code =
2260  transfer_string ((char *) buf, xflen, outlen, buflen, tmp, strlen (tmp), c_type, LANG_SYS_CODESET);
2261  }
2262  break;
2263  case DB_TYPE_C_NCHAR:

2266  char tmp[NUM_BUF_SIZE];
2267  sprintf (tmp, "%lld", (long long) bigint);
2268  error_code =
2269  transfer_string ((char *) buf, xflen, outlen, buflen, tmp, strlen (tmp), c_type, LANG_SYS_CODESET);
2270  }

2274  }

2276  break;

2278  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
2279  {

2281

2283  {
2284  case DB_TYPE_C_INT:
2285  {
2286  *(DB_C_INT *) buf = (DB_C_INT) f;
2287  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_INT);
2288  }
2289  break;
2290  case DB_TYPE_C_SHORT:
2291  {
2292  *(DB_C_SHORT *) buf = (DB_C_SHORT) f;
2293  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_SHORT);
2294  }
2295  break;
2296  case DB_TYPE_C_LONG:
2297  {
2298  *(DB_C_LONG *) buf = (DB_C_LONG) f;
2299  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_LONG);
2300  }
2301  break;
2302  case DB_TYPE_C_FLOAT:
2303  {
2304  *(DB_C_FLOAT *) buf = (DB_C_FLOAT) f;
2305  *xflen = sizeof (DB_C_FLOAT);

2321  }

2325  {

2944 /*
2945  * coerce_char_to_dbvalue() - Coerce the C character string into the
2946  * desired type and place in a DB_VALUE container.
2947  * return :
2948  * C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR - No errors occurred
2949  * C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION - The conversion to the db_value
2950  * type is not supported
2951  * value(in/out): DB_VALUE container for result. This also contains the DB
2952  * type to convert to.
2953  * buf(in) : Pointer to character buffer
2954  * buflen(in) : Length of character buffer (size in bytes)
2955  *
2956  */
2957 static int
2958 coerce_char_to_dbvalue (DB_VALUE * value, char *buf, const int buflen)
2959 {
2960  int status = C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR;
2961  DB_TYPE db_type = DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value);
2962 
2963  switch (db_type)
2964  {
2965  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
2966  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
2967  {
2968  int char_count;
2969  int precision = DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value);
2970 
2971  intl_char_count ((unsigned char *) buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, &char_count);
2972 
2973  if (precision == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE && buflen != 0)
2974  {
2975  precision = char_count;
2976  }
2977 
2978  if ((precision == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
2979  || (db_type == DB_TYPE_VARCHAR && precision >= char_count)
2980  || (db_type == DB_TYPE_CHAR && precision == char_count))
2981  {
2982  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, value, precision, buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
2983  }
2984  else
2985  {
2986  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
2987  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
2988  int error;
2989 
2990  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, &tmp_value, precision, buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
2991 
2992  error = db_char_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
2993  if (error != NO_ERROR)
2994  {
2995  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
2996  }
2997  else if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
2998  {
2999  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3000  }
3001 
3002  (void) db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3003  }
3004  }
3005  break;
3006  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
3007  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
3008  {
3009  int char_count;
3010  int precision = DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value);
3011 
3012  intl_char_count ((unsigned char *) buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, &char_count);
3013 
3014  if (precision == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3015  {
3016  precision = char_count;
3017  }
3018 
3019  if ((db_type == DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR && precision >= char_count)
3020  || (db_type == DB_TYPE_NCHAR && precision == char_count))
3021  {
3022 
3023  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, value, precision, buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
3024  }
3025  else
3026  {
3027  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3028  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3029 
3030  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, &tmp_value, precision, buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
3031 
3032  (void) db_char_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3033  if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3034  {
3035  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3036  }
3037 
3038  (void) db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3039  }
3040  }
3041  break;
3042  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
3043  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
3044  {
3045  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3046  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3047 
3048  db_value_domain_init (&tmp_value, db_type, DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION, DB_DEFAULT_SCALE);
3049  if (db_string_value (buf, buflen, "%H", &tmp_value) == NULL)
3050  {
3051  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3052  }
3053  else
3054  {
3055  /*
3056  * If the precision is not specified, fix it to
3057  * the input precision otherwise db_bit_string_coerce()
3058  * will fail.
3059  */
3060  if (DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value) == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3061  {
3062  db_value_domain_init (value, db_type, db_get_string_length (&tmp_value), DB_DEFAULT_SCALE);
3063  }
3064 
3065  (void) db_bit_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3066  if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3067  {
3068  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3069  }
3070  }
3071 
3072  (void) db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3073  }
3074  break;
3075  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3076  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
3077  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
3078  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
3079  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
3080  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
3081  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
3082  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3083  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
3084  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
3085  if (db_string_value (buf, buflen, "", value) == NULL)
3086  {
3087  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3088  }
3089  break;
3090  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
3091  {
3092  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3093  unsigned char new_num[DB_NUMERIC_BUF_SIZE];
3094  int desired_precision = DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value);
3095  int desired_scale = DB_VALUE_SCALE (value);
3096 
3097  /* string_to_num will coerce the string to a numeric, but will set the precision and scale based on the value
3098  * passed. Then we call num_to_num to coerce to the desired precision and scale. */
3099 
3100  if (numeric_coerce_string_to_num (buf, buflen, LANG_SYS_CODESET, &tmp_value) != NO_ERROR)
3101  {
3102  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3103  }
3104  else
3105  if (numeric_coerce_num_to_num
3106  (db_get_numeric (&tmp_value), DB_VALUE_PRECISION (&tmp_value),
3107  DB_VALUE_SCALE (&tmp_value), desired_precision, desired_scale, new_num) != NO_ERROR)
3108  {
3109  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3110  }
3111  else
3112  {
3113  /* Yes, I know that the precision and scale are already set, but this is neater than just assigning the
3114  * value. */
3115  db_make_numeric (value, new_num, desired_precision, desired_scale);
3116  }
3117 
3118  db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3119  }
3120  break;
3121  default:
3122  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
3123  break;
3124  }
3125 
3126  return status;
3127 }

3129 /*
3130  * coerce_numeric_to_dbvalue() - Coerce the C character number string
3131  * into the desired type and place in a DB_VALUE container.
3132  *
3133  * return :
3134  * C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR - no errors occurred
3135  * C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION - The conversion to the db_value
3136  * type is not supported.
3137  * value(out) : DB_VALUE container for result. This also contains the DB
3138  * type to convert to.
3139  * buf(in) : Pointer to character buffer.
3140  * c_type(in) : type of c string to coerce.
3141  */
3142 
3143 static int
3144 coerce_numeric_to_dbvalue (DB_VALUE * value, char *buf, const DB_TYPE_C c_type)
3145 {
3146  int status = C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR;
3147  DB_TYPE db_type = DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value);
3148 
3149  switch (c_type)
3150  {
3151  case DB_TYPE_C_INT:
3152  {
3153  DB_C_INT num = *(DB_C_INT *) buf;
3154 
3155  switch (db_type)
3156  {
3157  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
3158  {
3159  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3160  DB_VALUE value2;
3161 
3162  db_make_int (&value2, (int) num);
3163  (void) numeric_db_value_coerce_to_num (&value2, value, &data_status);
3164  }
3165  break;
3166  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
3167  db_make_int (value, (int) num);
3168  break;
3169  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
3170  db_make_bigint (value, (DB_C_BIGINT) num);
3171  break;
3172  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
3173  db_make_float (value, (DB_C_FLOAT) num);
3174  break;
3175  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3176  db_make_double (value, (DB_C_DOUBLE) num);
3177  break;
3178  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
3179  db_make_short (value, (DB_C_SHORT) num);
3180  break;
3181  case DB_TYPE_MONETARY:
3182  db_make_monetary (value, DB_CURRENCY_DEFAULT, (DB_C_DOUBLE) num);
3183  break;
3184  default:
3185  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
3186  break;
3187  }
3188  }
3189  break;
3190 
3191  case DB_TYPE_C_SHORT:
3192  {
3193  DB_C_SHORT num = *(DB_C_SHORT *) buf;
3194 
3195  switch (db_type)
3196  {
3197  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
3198  {
3199  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3200  DB_VALUE value2;
3201 
3202  db_make_short (&value2, (DB_C_SHORT) num);
3203  (void) numeric_db_value_coerce_to_num (&value2, value, &data_status);

3404 /*
3405  * coerce_binary_to_dbvalue() - Coerce a C bit type into the desired type
3406  * and place in a DB_VALUE container.
3407  * return :
3408  * C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR - No errors occurred
3409  * C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION - The conversion to the db_value
3410  * type is not supported
3411  * C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR - An error occurred during conversion
3412  * C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR - The input data was truncated
3413  * during coercion
3414  * value(in/out) : DB_VALUE container for result. This also contains the DB
3415  * type to convert to.
3416  * buf(in) : Pointer to data buffer
3417  * buflen(in) : Length of data (in bits)
3418  */
3419 static int
3420 coerce_binary_to_dbvalue (DB_VALUE * value, char *buf, const int buflen)
3421 {
3422  int status = C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR;
3423  DB_TYPE db_type = DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value);
3424 
3425  switch (db_type)
3426  {
3427  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
3428  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
3429  {
3430  int precision = DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value);
3431 
3432  if (precision == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE && buflen != 0)
3433  {
3434  precision = buflen;
3435  }
3436 
3437  if ((precision == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3438  || (db_type == DB_TYPE_VARBIT && precision >= buflen) || (db_type == DB_TYPE_BIT && precision == buflen))
3439  {
3440  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, value, precision, buf, buflen, INTL_CODESET_RAW_BITS, 0);
3441  }
3442  else
3443  {
3444  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3445  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3446  int error;
3447 
3448  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, &tmp_value, precision, buf, buflen, INTL_CODESET_RAW_BITS, 0);
3449 
3450  error = db_bit_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3451  if (error != NO_ERROR)
3452  {
3453  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3454  }
3455  else if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3456  {
3457  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3458  }
3459 
3460  (void) db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3461  }
3462  }
3463  break;
3464  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
3465  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
3466  {
3467  int error_code;
3468  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3469  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3470 
3471  db_make_varchar (&tmp_value, DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION, buf,
3472  QSTR_NUM_BYTES (buflen), LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
3473 
3474  /*
3475  * If the precision is not specified, fix it to
3476  * the input precision otherwise db_char_string_coerce()
3477  * will fail.
3478  */
3479  if (DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value) == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3480  {
3481  db_value_domain_init (value, db_type, QSTR_NUM_BYTES (buflen), 0);
3482  }
3483 
3484  error_code = db_char_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3485  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
3486  {
3487  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3488  }
3489  else if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3490  {
3491  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3492  }
3493 
3494  error_code = db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3495  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
3496  {
3497  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3498  }
3499  }
3500  break;
3501  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
3502  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
3503  {
3504  int error_code;
3505  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3506  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3507 
3508  db_make_varnchar (&tmp_value, DB_DEFAULT_PRECISION, buf,
3509  QSTR_NUM_BYTES (buflen), LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
3510 
3511  /*
3512  * If the precision is not specified, fix it to
3513  * the input precision otherwise db_char_string_coerce()
3514  * will fail.
3515  */
3516  if (DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value) == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3517  {
3518  db_value_domain_init (value, db_type, QSTR_NUM_BYTES (buflen), 0);
3519  }
3520 
3521  error_code = db_char_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3522  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
3523  {
3524  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3525  }
3526  else if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3527  {
3528  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3529  }
3530 
3531  error_code = db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3532  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
3533  {
3534  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3535  }
3536  }
3537  break;
3538  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
3539  db_make_int (value, *(int *) buf);
3540  break;
3541  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
3542  db_make_bigint (value, *(DB_C_BIGINT *) buf);
3543  break;
3544  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
3545  db_make_float (value, *(DB_C_FLOAT *) buf);
3546  break;
3547  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3548  db_make_double (value, *(DB_C_DOUBLE *) buf);
3549  break;
3550  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
3551  db_make_short (value, *(DB_C_SHORT *) buf);
3552  break;
3553  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
3554  db_value_put_encoded_date (value, (DB_DATE *) buf);
3555  break;
3556  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
3557  db_value_put_encoded_time (value, (DB_TIME *) buf);
3558  break;
3559  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3560  db_make_timestamp (value, *(DB_TIMESTAMP *) buf);
3561  break;
3562  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
3563  db_make_datetime (value, (DB_DATETIME *) buf);
3564  break;
3565  default:
3566  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
3567  break;
3568  }
3569 
3570  return status;
3571 }

3573 /*
3574  * coerce_date_to_dbvalue() - Coerce a C date type into the desired type
3575  * and place in a DB_VALUE container.
3576  * return :
3577  * C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR - No errors occurred
3578  * C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION - The conversion to the db_value
3579  * type is not supported
3580  * C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR - An error occurred during conversion
3581  *
3582  * value(in/out): DB_VALUE container for result. This also contains the DB
3583  * type to convert to.
3584  * buf(in) : Pointer to data buffer.
3585  *
3586  */
3587 static int
3588 coerce_date_to_dbvalue (DB_VALUE * value, char *buf)
3589 {
3590  int status = C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR;
3591  DB_TYPE db_type = DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value);
3592  DB_C_DATE *date = (DB_C_DATE *) buf;
3593 
3594  switch (db_type)
3595  {
3596  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
3597  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
3598  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
3599  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
3600  {
3601  DB_DATE db_date;
3602  char tmp[DATE_BUF_SIZE];
3603 
3604  if (db_date_encode (&db_date, date->month, date->day, date->year) !=
3605  NO_ERROR || db_date_to_string (tmp, DATE_BUF_SIZE, &db_date) == 0)
3606  {
3607  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3608  }
3609  else
3610  {
3611  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3612  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3613  int length = strlen (tmp);
3614 
3615  if (length == 0)
3616  {
3617  length = 1;
3618  }
3619 
3620  db_make_null (&tmp_value);
3621  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, &tmp_value, length, tmp, length, LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
3622 
3623  /*
3624  * If the precision is not specified, fix it to
3625  * the input precision otherwise db_char_string_coerce()
3626  * will fail.
3627  */
3628  if (DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value) == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3629  {
3630  db_value_domain_init (value, db_type, length, 0);
3631  }
3632 
3633  (void) db_char_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3634  if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3635  {
3636  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3637  }
3638 
3639  (void) db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3640  }
3641  }
3642  break;
3643  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
3644  db_make_date (value, date->month, date->day, date->year);
3645  break;
3646  default:
3647  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
3648  break;
3649  }
3650 
3651  return status;
3652 }

3852  *
3853  */
3854 static int
3855 coerce_datetime_to_dbvalue (DB_VALUE * value, char *buf)
3856 {
3857  int status = C_TO_VALUE_NOERROR;
3858  DB_TYPE db_type = DB_VALUE_DOMAIN_TYPE (value);
3859  DB_DATETIME *datetime = (DB_DATETIME *) buf;
3860 
3861  switch (db_type)
3862  {
3863  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
3864  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
3865  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
3866  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
3867  {
3868  char tmp[DATETIME_BUF_SIZE];
3869 
3870  if (db_datetime_string (datetime, "", tmp, DATETIME_BUF_SIZE) != 0)
3871  {
3872  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3873  }
3874  else
3875  {
3876  DB_VALUE tmp_value;
3877  DB_DATA_STATUS data_status;
3878  int length = strlen (tmp);
3879 
3880  if (length == 0)
3881  {
3882  length = 1;
3883  }
3884 
3885  db_make_null (&tmp_value);
3886  qstr_make_typed_string (db_type, &tmp_value, length, tmp, length, LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
3887 
3888  /*
3889  * If the precision is not specified, fix it to
3890  * the input precision otherwise db_char_string_coerce()
3891  * will fail.
3892  */
3893  if (DB_VALUE_PRECISION (value) == TP_FLOATING_PRECISION_VALUE)
3894  {
3895  db_value_domain_init (value, db_type, length, 0);
3896  }
3897 
3898  (void) db_char_string_coerce (&tmp_value, value, &data_status);
3899  if (data_status == DATA_STATUS_TRUNCATED)
3900  {
3901  status = C_TO_VALUE_TRUNCATION_ERROR;
3902  }
3903 
3904  (void) db_value_clear (&tmp_value);
3905  }
3906  }
3907  break;
3908  case DB_TYPE_DATE:
3909  {
3910  DB_DATE tmp_date;
3911 
3912  tmp_date = datetime->date;
3913  db_value_put_encoded_date (value, &tmp_date);
3914  }
3915  break;
3916  case DB_TYPE_TIME:
3917  {
3918  DB_TIME tmp_time;
3919 
3920  tmp_time = datetime->time / 1000;
3921  db_value_put_encoded_time (value, &tmp_time);
3922  }
3923  break;
3924  case DB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3925  {
3926  DB_TIMESTAMP tmp_timestamp;
3927  DB_DATE tmp_date;
3928  DB_TIME tmp_time;
3929 
3930  tmp_date = datetime->date;
3931  tmp_time = datetime->time / 1000;
3932  db_value_put_encoded_date (value, &tmp_date);
3933  db_value_put_encoded_time (value, &tmp_time);
3934  if (db_timestamp_encode_ses (&tmp_date, &tmp_time, &tmp_timestamp, NULL) != NO_ERROR)
3935  {
3936  status = C_TO_VALUE_CONVERSION_ERROR;
3937  }
3938  else
3939  {
3940  db_make_timestamp (value, tmp_timestamp);
3941  }
3942  break;
3943  }
3944  case DB_TYPE_DATETIME:
3945  {
3946  db_make_datetime (value, datetime);
3947  break;
3948  }
3949  default:
3950  status = C_TO_VALUE_UNSUPPORTED_CONVERSION;
3951  break;
3952  }
3953 
3954  return status;
3955 }

3962  * db_domain_next() - This can be used to iterate through a list of domain
3963  * descriptors returned by functions such as db_attribute_domain.

3965  * domain(in): domain descriptor.
