3980 /*
3981  * db_domain_type() - See the note below.
3982  * return : type identifier constant.
3983  * domain(in): domain descriptor.
3984  *
3985  * note:
3986  * Returns the basic type identifier for a domain descriptor.
3987  * This will be a numeric value as defined by the DB_TYPE_ enumeration.
3988  * IFF this value is DB_TYPE_OBJECT then the domain will have additional
3989  * information in the "class" field that can be accessed with
3990  * db_domain_class. This will tell you the specific class that was
3991  * defined for this domain. If the class field is NULL, the domain is
3992  * a generic object and can be a reference to any object. IFF the domain
3993  * type is DB_TYPE_SET, DB_TYPE_MULTISET, or DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE, there
3994  * will be additional domain information in the "set" field of the domain
3995  * descriptor that can be accessed with db_domain_set. This will be
3996  * an additional list of domain descriptors that define the domains of the
3997  * elements of the set.
3998  */
3999 DB_TYPE
4000 db_domain_type (const DB_DOMAIN * domain)
4001 {
4002  return TP_DOMAIN_TYPE (domain);
4003 }
4004 
4005 /*
4006  * db_domain_class() - see the note below.
4007  *
4008  * return : a class pointer
4009  * domain(in) : domain descriptor
4010  * note:
4011  * This can be used to get the specific domain class for a domain whose
4012  * basic type is DB_TYPE_OBJECT. This value may be NULL indicating that
4013  * the domain is the general object domain and can reference any type of
4014  * object.
4015  * This should check to see if the domain class was dropped. This won't
4016  * happen in the ususal case because the domain list is filtered by
4017  * db_attribute_domain and related functions which always serve as the
4018  * sources for this list. Filtering again here would slow it down
4019  * even more. If it is detected as deleted and we downgrade to
4020  * "object", this could leave the containing domain list will multiple
4021  * object domains.
4022  */
4023 DB_OBJECT *
4024 db_domain_class (const DB_DOMAIN * domain)
4025 {
4026  DB_OBJECT *class_mop = NULL;
4027 
4028  if ((domain != NULL) && (domain->type == tp_Type_object))
4029  {
4030  class_mop = domain->class_mop;
4031  }
4032 
4033  return (class_mop);
4034 }
4035 
4036 /*
4037  * db_domain_set() - see the note below.
4038  * return : domain descriptor or NULL.
4039  * domain(in): domain descriptor.
4040  *
4041  * note:
4042  * This can be used to get set domain information for a domain
4043  * whose basic type is DB_TYPE_SET, DB_TYPE_MULTISET, or DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE
4044  * This field will always be NULL for any other kind of basic type.
4045  * This field may be NULL even for set types if there was no additional
4046  * domain information specified when the attribute was defined.
4047  * The returned domain list can be examined just like other domain
4048  * descriptors using the db_domain functions. In theory, domains
4049  * could be fully hierarchical by containing nested sets. Currently,
4050  * this is not allowed by the schema manager but it may be allowed
4051  * in the future.
4052  */
4053 DB_DOMAIN *
4054 db_domain_set (const DB_DOMAIN * domain)
4055 {
4056  DB_DOMAIN *setdomain = NULL;
4057 
4058  if ((domain != NULL) && (pr_is_set_type (TP_DOMAIN_TYPE (domain)) || TP_DOMAIN_TYPE (domain) == DB_TYPE_MIDXKEY))
4059  {
4060  setdomain = domain->setdomain;
4061  }
4062 
4063  return (setdomain);
4064 }

4205 /*
4206  * vc_append_bytes(): append a string to string buffer
4207  *
4208  * returns: on success, ptr to concatenated string. otherwise, NULL.
4209  * old_string(IN/OUT): original string
4210  * new_tail(IN): string to be appended
4211  * new_tail_length(IN): length of the string to be appended
4212  *
4213  */
4214 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4215 valcnv_append_bytes (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const char *new_tail_p, const size_t new_tail_length)
4216 {
4217  size_t old_length;
4218 
4219  if (new_tail_p == NULL)
4220  {
4221  return buffer_p;
4222  }
4223  else if (buffer_p == NULL)
4224  {
4225  buffer_p = (VALCNV_BUFFER *) malloc (sizeof (VALCNV_BUFFER));
4226  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4227  {
4228  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, sizeof (VALCNV_BUFFER));
4229  return NULL;
4230  }
4231 
4232  buffer_p->length = 0;
4233  buffer_p->bytes = NULL;
4234  }
4235 
4236  old_length = buffer_p->length;
4237  buffer_p->length += new_tail_length;
4238 
4239  buffer_p->bytes = (unsigned char *) realloc (buffer_p->bytes, buffer_p->length);
4240  if (buffer_p->bytes == NULL)
4241  {
4242  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_OUT_OF_VIRTUAL_MEMORY, 1, buffer_p->length);
4243  return NULL;
4244  }
4245 
4246  memcpy (&buffer_p->bytes[old_length], new_tail_p, new_tail_length);
4247  return buffer_p;
4248 }
4249 
4250 /*
4251  * vc_append_string(): append a string to string buffer
4252  *
4253  * returns: on success, ptr to concatenated string. otherwise, NULL.
4254  * old_string(IN/OUT): original string
4255  * new_tail(IN): string to be appended
4256  *
4257  */
4258 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4259 valcnv_append_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const char *new_tail_p)
4260 {
4261  return valcnv_append_bytes (buffer_p, new_tail_p, strlen (new_tail_p));
4262 }

4264 /*
4265  * vc_float_to_string(): append float value to string buffer
4266  *
4267  * returns: on success, ptr to converted string. otherwise, NULL.
4268  * buf(IN/OUT): buffer
4269  * value(IN): floating point value which is to be converted
4270  *
4271  */
4272 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4273 valcnv_convert_float_to_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const float value)
4274 {
4275  char tbuf[24];
4276 
4277  sprintf (tbuf, "%.17g", value);
4278 
4279 #if defined(HPUX)
4280  /* workaround for HP's broken printf */
4281  if (strstr (tbuf, "++") || strstr (tbuf, "--"))
4282 #else /* HPUX */
4283  if (strstr (tbuf, "Inf"))
4284 #endif /* HPUX */
4285  {
4286  sprintf (tbuf, "%.17g", (value > 0 ? FLT_MAX : -FLT_MAX));
4287  }
4288 
4289  return valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, tbuf);
4290 }

4292 /*
4293  * vc_double_to_string(): append double value to string buffer
4294  *

4296  * buf : buffer
4297  * value(IN): double value which is to be converted
4298  *
4299  */
4300 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4301 valcnv_convert_double_to_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const double value)
4302 {

4304 
4305  sprintf (tbuf, "%.17g", value);
4306 
4307 #if defined(HPUX)
4308  /* workaround for HP's broken printf */
4309  if (strstr (tbuf, "++") || strstr (tbuf, "--"))
4310 #else /* HPUX */
4311  if (strstr (tbuf, "Inf"))
4312 #endif /* HPUX */
4313  {
4314  sprintf (tbuf, "%.17g", (value > 0 ? DBL_MAX : -DBL_MAX));

4320 /*
4321  * vc_bit_to_string(): append bit value to string buffer
4322  *
4323  * returns: on success, ptr to converted string. otherwise, NULL.
4324  * buf(IN/OUT): buffer
4325  * value(IN): BIT value which is to be converted
4326  *
4327  */
4328 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4329 valcnv_convert_bit_to_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const DB_VALUE * value_p)
4330 {
4331  unsigned char *bit_string_p;
4332  int nibble_len, nibbles, count;
4333  char tbuf[10];
4334 
4335  bit_string_p = (unsigned char *) db_get_string (value_p);
4336  nibble_len = (db_get_string_length (value_p) + 3) / 4;
4337 
4338  for (nibbles = 0, count = 0; nibbles < nibble_len - 1; count++, nibbles += 2)
4339  {
4340  sprintf (tbuf, "%02x", bit_string_p[count]);
4341  tbuf[2] = '\0';
4342  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, tbuf);
4343  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4344  {
4345  return NULL;
4346  }
4347  }
4348 
4349  if (nibbles < nibble_len)
4350  {
4351  sprintf (tbuf, "%1x", bit_string_p[count]);
4352  tbuf[1] = '\0';
4353  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, tbuf);
4354  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4355  {
4356  return NULL;
4357  }
4358  }
4359 
4360  return buffer_p;
4361 }
4362 
4363 /*
4364  * vc_set_to_string(): append set value to string buffer
4365  *
4366  * returns: on success, ptr to converted string. otherwise, NULL.
4367  * buf(IN/OUT): buffer
4368  * set(IN): SET value which is to be converted
4369  *
4370  */
4371 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4372 valcnv_convert_set_to_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, DB_SET * set_p)
4373 {
4374  DB_VALUE value;
4375  int err, size, max_n, i;
4376 
4377  if (set_p == NULL)
4378  {
4379  return buffer_p;
4380  }
4381 
4382  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "{");
4383  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4384  {
4385  return NULL;
4386  }
4387 
4388  size = set_size (set_p);
4389  if (valcnv_Max_set_elements == 0)
4390  {
4391  max_n = size;
4392  }
4393  else
4394  {
4395  max_n = MIN (size, valcnv_Max_set_elements);
4396  }
4397 
4398  for (i = 0; i < max_n; i++)
4399  {
4400  err = set_get_element (set_p, i, &value);
4401  if (err < 0)
4402  {
4403  return NULL;
4404  }
4405 
4406  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_db_value_to_string (buffer_p, &value);
4407  pr_clear_value (&value);
4408  if (i < size - 1)
4409  {
4410  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, ", ");
4411  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4412  {
4413  return NULL;
4414  }
4415  }
4416  }
4417 
4418  if (i < size)
4419  {
4420  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "...");
4421  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4422  {
4423  return NULL;
4424  }
4425  }
4426 
4427  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "}");
4428  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4429  {
4430  return NULL;
4431  }
4432 
4433  return buffer_p;
4434 }
4435 
4436 /*
4437  * vc_money_to_string(): append monetary value to string buffer
4438  *
4439  * returns: on success, ptr to converted string. otherwise, NULL.
4440  * value(IN): monetary value which is to be converted
4441  *
4442  */
4443 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4444 valcnv_convert_money_to_string (const double value)
4445 {
4446  char cbuf[LDBL_MAX_10_EXP + 20]; /* 20 == floating fudge factor */
4447 
4448  sprintf (cbuf, "%.2f", value);
4449 
4450 #if defined(HPUX)
4451  /* workaround for HP's broken printf */
4452  if (strstr (cbuf, "++") || strstr (cbuf, "--"))
4453 #else /* HPUX */
4454  if (strstr (cbuf, "Inf"))
4455 #endif /* HPUX */
4456  {
4457  sprintf (cbuf, "%.2f", (value > 0 ? DBL_MAX : -DBL_MAX));
4458  }
4459 
4460  return valcnv_append_string (NULL, cbuf);
4461 }
4462 
4463 /*
4464  * vc_data_to_string(): append a value to string buffer
4465  *
4466  * returns: on success, ptr to converted string. otherwise, NULL.
4467  * buf(IN/OUT): buffer
4468  * value(IN): a value which is to be converted
4469  *
4470  */
4471 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4472 valcnv_convert_data_to_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const DB_VALUE * value_p)
4473 {
4474  OID *oid_p;
4475  DB_SET *set_p;
4476  DB_ELO *elo_p;
4477  char *src_p, *end_p, *p;
4478  ptrdiff_t len;
4479 
4480  DB_MONETARY *money_p;
4481  VALCNV_BUFFER *money_string_p;
4482  const char *currency_symbol_p;
4483  double amount;
4484  DB_VALUE dbval;
4485 
4486  char line[1025];
4487 
4488  int cnt;
4489 
4490  if (DB_IS_NULL (value_p))
4491  {
4492  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "NULL");
4493  }
4494  else
4495  {
4496  switch (DB_VALUE_TYPE (value_p))
4497  {
4498  case DB_TYPE_INTEGER:
4499  sprintf (line, "%d", db_get_int (value_p));
4500  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4501  break;
4502 
4503  case DB_TYPE_BIGINT:
4504  sprintf (line, "%lld", (long long) db_get_bigint (value_p));
4505  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4506  break;
4507 
4508  case DB_TYPE_SHORT:
4509  sprintf (line, "%d", (int) db_get_short (value_p));
4510  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4511  break;
4512 
4513  case DB_TYPE_FLOAT:
4514  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_float_to_string (buffer_p, db_get_float (value_p));
4515  break;
4516 
4517  case DB_TYPE_DOUBLE:
4518  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_double_to_string (buffer_p, db_get_double (value_p));
4519  break;
4520 
4521  case DB_TYPE_NUMERIC:
4522  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, numeric_db_value_print (value_p, line));
4523  break;
4524 
4525  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
4526  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
4527  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_bit_to_string (buffer_p, value_p);
4528  break;
4529 
4530  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
4531  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
4532  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
4533  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
4534  src_p = db_get_string (value_p);
4535 
4536  if (src_p != NULL && db_get_string_size (value_p) == 0)
4537  {
4538  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "");
4539  return buffer_p;
4540  }
4541 
4542  end_p = src_p + db_get_string_size (value_p);
4543  while (src_p < end_p)
4544  {
4545  for (p = src_p; p < end_p && *p != '\''; p++)
4546  {
4547  ;
4548  }
4549 
4550  if (p < end_p)
4551  {
4552  len = p - src_p + 1;
4553  buffer_p = valcnv_append_bytes (buffer_p, src_p, len);
4554  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4555  {
4556  return NULL;
4557  }
4558 
4559  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "'");
4560  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4561  {
4562  return NULL;
4563  }
4564  }
4565  else
4566  {
4567  buffer_p = valcnv_append_bytes (buffer_p, src_p, end_p - src_p);
4568  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4569  {
4570  return NULL;
4571  }
4572  }
4573 
4574  src_p = p + 1;
4575  }
4576  break;
4577 
4578  case DB_TYPE_OID:
4579  oid_p = (OID *) db_get_oid (value_p);
4580 
4581  sprintf (line, "%d", (int) oid_p->volid);
4582  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4583  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4584  {
4585  return NULL;
4586  }
4587 
4588  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "|");
4589  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4590  {
4591  return NULL;
4592  }
4593 
4594  sprintf (line, "%d", (int) oid_p->pageid);
4595  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4596  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4597  {
4598  return NULL;
4599  }
4600 
4601  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "|");
4602  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4603  {
4604  return NULL;
4605  }
4606 
4607  sprintf (line, "%d", (int) oid_p->slotid);
4608  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4609  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4610  {
4611  return NULL;
4612  }
4613 
4614  break;
4615 
4616  case DB_TYPE_SET:
4617  case DB_TYPE_MULTISET:
4618  case DB_TYPE_SEQUENCE:
4619  set_p = db_get_set (value_p);
4620  if (set_p == NULL)
4621  {
4622  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "NULL");
4623  }
4624  else
4625  {
4626  return valcnv_convert_set_to_string (buffer_p, set_p);
4627  }
4628 
4629  break;
4630 
4631  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
4632  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
4633  elo_p = db_get_elo (value_p);
4634  if (elo_p == NULL)
4635  {
4636  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "NULL");
4637  }
4638  else
4639  {
4640  if (elo_p->type == ELO_FBO)
4641  {
4642  assert (elo_p->locator != NULL);
4643  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, elo_p->locator);
4644  }
4645  else /* ELO_LO */
4646  {
4647  /* should not happen for now */
4648  assert (0);
4649  }
4650  }
4651  break;
4652 
4653  case DB_TYPE_TIME:

4655  if (cnt == 0)
4656  {
4657  return NULL;
4658  }
4659  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);

4664  if (cnt == 0)
4665  {
4666  return NULL;
4667  }
4668  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, line);
4669  break;

4672  {
4673  DB_TIMESTAMPTZ *ts_tz = db_get_timestamptz (value_p);

4676  if (cnt == 0)
4677  {
4678  return NULL;

4681  }

4800 /*
4801  * vc_db_value_to_string(): append a value to string buffer with a type prefix
4802  *
4803  * returns: on success, ptr to converted string. otherwise, NULL.
4804  * buf(IN/OUT): buffer
4805  * value(IN): a value which is to be converted
4806  *
4807  */
4808 static VALCNV_BUFFER *
4809 valcnv_convert_db_value_to_string (VALCNV_BUFFER * buffer_p, const DB_VALUE * value_p)
4810 {
4811  if (DB_IS_NULL (value_p))
4812  {
4813  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "NULL");
4814  }
4815  else
4816  {
4817  switch (DB_VALUE_TYPE (value_p))
4818  {
4819  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
4820  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
4821  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "X'");
4822  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4823  {
4824  return NULL;
4825  }
4826 
4827  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_data_to_string (buffer_p, value_p);
4828  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4829  {
4830  return NULL;
4831  }
4832 
4833  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "'");
4834  break;
4835 
4836  case DB_TYPE_BLOB:
4837  case DB_TYPE_CLOB:
4838  if (DB_VALUE_TYPE (value_p) == DB_TYPE_BLOB)
4839  {
4840  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "BLOB'");
4841  }
4842  else
4843  {
4844  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "CLOB'");
4845  }
4846 
4847  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4848  {
4849  return NULL;
4850  }
4851 
4852  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_data_to_string (buffer_p, value_p);
4853  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4854  {
4855  return NULL;
4856  }
4857 
4858  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "'");
4859  break;
4860 
4861  case DB_TYPE_ENUMERATION:
4862  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "'");
4863  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4864  {
4865  return NULL;
4866  }
4867 
4868  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_data_to_string (buffer_p, value_p);
4869  if (buffer_p == NULL)
4870  {
4871  return NULL;
4872  }
4873 
4874  buffer_p = valcnv_append_string (buffer_p, "'");
4875  break;
4876 
4877  default:
4878  buffer_p = valcnv_convert_data_to_string (buffer_p, value_p);
4879  break;
4880  }
4881  }
4882 
4883  return buffer_p;
4884 }

4886 /*
4887  * valcnv_convert_value_to_string(): convert a value to a string type value
4888  *
4889  * returns: on success, NO_ERROR. otherwise, ER_FAILED.
4890  * value(IN/OUT): a value which is to be converted to string
4891  * Note that the value is cleaned up during conversion.
4892  *
4893  */
4894 int
4895 valcnv_convert_value_to_string (DB_VALUE * value_p)
4896 {
4897  VALCNV_BUFFER buffer = { 0, NULL };
4898  VALCNV_BUFFER *buf_p;
4899  DB_VALUE src_value;
4900 
4901  if (!DB_IS_NULL (value_p))
4902  {
4903  buf_p = &buffer;
4904  buf_p = valcnv_convert_db_value_to_string (buf_p, value_p);
4905  if (buf_p == NULL)
4906  {
4907  return ER_FAILED;
4908  }
4909 
4910  db_make_varchar (&src_value, DB_MAX_STRING_LENGTH,
4911  (char *) buf_p->bytes, CAST_STRLEN (buf_p->length), LANG_SYS_CODESET, LANG_SYS_COLLATION);
4912 
4913  pr_clear_value (value_p);
4914  (*(tp_String.setval)) (value_p, &src_value, true);
4915 
4916  pr_clear_value (&src_value);
4917  free_and_init (buf_p->bytes);
4918  }
4919 
4920  return NO_ERROR;
4921 }

4974 int
4975 db_convert_json_into_scalar (const DB_VALUE * src, DB_VALUE * dest)
4976 {
4977  CHECK_2ARGS_ERROR (src, dest);
4978  JSON_DOC *doc = db_get_json_document (src);
4979 
4980  assert (doc != NULL);
4981 
4982  switch (db_json_get_type (doc))
4983  {
4984  case DB_JSON_STRING:
4985  {
4986  const char *str = db_json_get_string_from_document (doc);
4987  int error_code = db_make_string_by_const_str (dest, str);
4988  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
4989  {
4990  ASSERT_ERROR ();
4991  return error_code;
4992  }
4993  break;
4994  }
4995  case DB_JSON_INT:
4996  {
4997  int val = db_json_get_int_from_document (doc);
4998  db_make_int (dest, val);
4999  break;
5000  }
5001  case DB_JSON_DOUBLE:
5002  {
5003  double val = db_json_get_double_from_document (doc);
5004  db_make_double (dest, val);
5005  break;
5006  }
5007  case DB_JSON_BOOL:
5008  {
5009  char *str = db_json_get_bool_as_str_from_document (doc);
5010  int error_code = db_make_string (dest, str);
5011  if (error_code != NO_ERROR)
5012  {
5013  ASSERT_ERROR ();
5014  return error_code;
5015  }
5016  dest->need_clear = true;
5017  break;
5018  }
5019  case DB_JSON_NULL:
5020  db_make_null (dest);
5021  break;
5022  default:
5023  assert (false);
5024  return ER_FAILED;
5025  }
5026 
5027  return NO_ERROR;
5028 }

5072 /*

5077  */
5078 bool
5079 db_value_is_corrupted (const DB_VALUE * value)
5080 {

5082  {

5085 
5086  switch (value->domain.general_info.type)

5090  {
5091  return true;
5092  }
5093  break;
5094 
5095  case DB_TYPE_BIT:
5096  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (value->domain.char_info.length, DB_MAX_BIT_PRECISION))
5097  {
5098  return true;
5099  }
5100  break;
5101 
5102  case DB_TYPE_VARBIT:
5103  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (value->domain.char_info.length, DB_MAX_VARBIT_PRECISION))
5104  {
5105  return true;
5106  }
5107  break;
5108 
5109  case DB_TYPE_CHAR:
5110  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (value->domain.char_info.length, DB_MAX_CHAR_PRECISION))
5111  {
5112  return true;
5113  }
5114  break;
5115 
5116  case DB_TYPE_NCHAR:
5117  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (value->domain.char_info.length, DB_MAX_NCHAR_PRECISION))
5118  {
5119  return true;
5120  }
5121  break;
5122 
5123  case DB_TYPE_VARCHAR:
5124  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (value->domain.char_info.length, DB_MAX_VARCHAR_PRECISION))
5125  {
5126  return true;
5127  }
5128  break;
5129 
5130  case DB_TYPE_VARNCHAR:
5131  if (IS_INVALID_PRECISION (value->domain.char_info.length, DB_MAX_VARNCHAR_PRECISION))
5132  {
5133  return true;

5137  default:
